physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features four children. Three of them are standing up while the other sits on the right hand side of the photograph, on some grass. All of them are looking towards the direction where the photograph was taken. The two children standing on the left are dressed in identical costume. The one in the centre adorns a military uniform and has a rifle slung over his right shoulder. The child on the right has hat on and is holding onto a bottle as well.
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a group of children posing as if they were in the countryside.

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Photograph of a group of Peranakan children
subject_terms_1: studio portraits group portraits children (people by age group)
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Portraits, Group Children Peranakan (Asian people)
